intro: Licania columbarum, commonly known as the columnar licania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Licania columbarum is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and moist woodlands.
